No. A-11011/03/2022-Ins.I dated 31.10.2022 has conveyed that the Central Government in exercise of its powers under Article No. 76(ii) of the Articles of Association of the Corporation has appointed:  Ms. Madhulika Bhaskar currently General Manager of the Corporation as General Manager and Director on the Board of the Corporation w.e.f the date of assumption of office & upto the date of attaining the age of superannuation (i.e. 30.06.2023), or until further orders, whichever is earlier. AIA Engineering Limited has informed the Exchange that pursuant to Regulation 30 of SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements), Regulations 2015, The Canada Border Services Agency (CBSA) has decided to carry out a review of the on-going administration (and obligations for The Company) of the anti-dumping finding for export of certain grinding media to Canada destined for the mining sector to inquire about any change in input costs and sales data from the time the order was last issued on 29 July 2021. This is a standard procedure carried out when there may be material changes in market conditions including input costs. The Company will continue to co-operate with CBSA in this process and will comply with any new guidelines that will be published in this regard. Our total sales of Grinding Media in Canada during Financial Year 2021-22 was 3002 MT (including 1220 MT of Mining Grinding Media).

Pursuant to provisions of Regulation 30(6) of SEBI (Listing Obligations & Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015, it is hereby informed that Shri Hardeep Singh (ITS:1990), Additional DG, DGFT has assumed the charge of Chairman and Managing Director, MMTC Limited (Additional Charge) w.e.f. 27.10.2022 for a period of six months or until further orders, whichever is earlier in terms of Office Order No.A-12022/20/2019-E-IV  dated 26th October, 2022 of Department of Commerce, MoC&I, Govt. of India.	Shri Hardeep Singh, aged 57 years, belongs to Indian Trade Service 1990 Batch and  holds B.Com(Hons) Degree from SRCC, Delhi University and LLB from Campus Law Centre, Delhi University.  Prior to his current position of Additional Director General, DGFT since 2019, he has worked  as ADG, DDG and JDG in DGFT. He also worked as PS to Hon￢ﾀﾙble Minister, Food Processing Industries, Govt. of India during the period 2014-2019. 	It is hereby informed that Shri Hardeep Singh is not related to any other Director on the Board of the Company on the date of his appointment in MMTC Limited and is not debarred from holding the office of CMD pursuant to any SEBI order or order of any other such authority.

Mangalore Refinery and Petrochemicals Limited has informed the Exchange about Notice of Postal BallotPursuant to Regulation 30 read with Part A of Schedule III of SEBI (Listing Obligation and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015, we wish to inform that the proposal for approval of the shareholders for appointment of Directors has been scheduled through Postal Ballot.  Friday, October 21, 2022 was the Cut-off date for determining eligibility of shareholders for remote e ￢ﾀﾓvoting. Any person, who was a member of the Company as on October 21, 2022  was entitled to vote through remote e-voting/ e- voting. The remote e-voting period commences on Saturday, October 29, 2022 (9:00 a.m.) and ends on Sunday, November 27, 2022 (5:00 p.m.). The remote e-voting module shall be disabled by CDSL for voting thereafter. The notice of Postal Ballot dated October 28, 2022 which has been sent to the members for seeking their approval by means of postal ballot through remote e-voting is enclosed. A public notice on the above information is also being published in the newspapers.We request you to take the above on records.Thanking You.Yours faithfully,For Mangalore Refinery and Petrochemicals Limited   Sd/-K B Shyam KumarCompany SecretaryEncl: A/a

Oriental InfraTrust has informed the Exchange about Disclosure under clause 23(6) of the SEBI INVIT Regulation. In continuation to our intimation dated 09.05.2022, 10.06.2022, 08.08.2022 and 21.10.2022, We wish to inform that in accordance the definitive agreements executed by Oriental InfraTrust with the Sponsorsviz; M/s Oriental Structural Engineers Private Limited and Oriental Tollways Private Limited for acquisition of 100% stake in the ROFO asset viz; Biaora to Dewas Highway Private Limited (￯﾿ﾢ￯ﾾﾀ￯ﾾﾜBDHPL￯﾿ﾢ￯ﾾﾀ￯ﾾﾝ), The Trust hascompleted the acquisition of BDHPL today;In connection with the Oriental InfraTrust￯﾿ﾢ￯ﾾﾀ￯ﾾﾙs acquisition of 100% equity shareholding and economic interest in the BDHPL entire consideration has been paid by way of cash. Oriental InfraTrust has raised the cash for the consideration by way of availing Term Loan facility from L&T Finance Limited and IndusInd Bank Limited. Brief details of the Investment is enclosed herewith and is also updated on the website of the trust at www.orientalinfratrust.comPlease note as per our intimation dated 21.10.2022 the trading window for dealing in the units of the Trust is already closed and the same will open 48 hours after this announcement. Please take the same on record.

In continuation to our intimation dated 09.05.2022, 10.06.2022 and 08.08.2022, we would like to intimate that Oriental InfraTrust has availed Term Loan facility for Rs. 1,350 Cr. on 20.10.2022 from L&T Finance Limited and IndusInd Bank Limited.The term loan shall be utilized for acquisition of ROFO asset viz; Biaora to Dewas Highway Private Limited (￯﾿ﾢ￯ﾾﾀ￯ﾾﾜBDHPL￯﾿ﾢ￯ﾾﾀ￯ﾾﾝ), on-lending to BDHPL for refinancing its unsecured loan, creation of debt service reserve, major maintenance reserve & other reserves and for meeting transaction expenses. The aforementioned borrowing along with the existing debt of the BDHPL exceeds 15% of the value of the Oriental InfraTrust assets.Please note as per the InvIT Documents of the Trust the trading window for dealing in the units of the Trust will be closed from 21.10.2022 and will open 48 hours after the announcement of outcome for completion of acquisition of the ROFO asset to the public.Please take the same on record.

Whether order(s) / contract(s) is awarded to domestic/ international entity2. Significant terms and conditions of order(s)/contract(s) awarded, in brief;3. Time period, if any, associated with  the order(s)/contract(s);4. Broad commercial consideration or size of the order(s)/contract(s);5. Whether the promoter/ promoter group/group companies have any interest in that entity to whom the order(s)/contract(s) is awarded? If Yes, nature of interest and details thereof;6. Whether the same would fall within related party transactions? If yes, whether the same is done at ?arms length?.The response of the company is attached.

Factory/unit where the strike/lock out takes place including reasons for such strike.The response of the company is attached.

We are pleased to inform that our associate company, East Pipes Integrated Company for Industry (EPIC) in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia (KSA), has announced that its shareholders have approved the Board of Director￢ﾀﾙs recommendation to grant bonus shares in the ratio of 1:2 through the capitalization of SAR 105 million from retained earnings.  The share capital of EPIC will increase by 50% from SAR 210 million to SAR 315 million. The number of shares before the increase is 21,000,000 and after the increase will become 31,500,000 shares. By increasing its capital, EPIC aims to maximize shareholders wealth that balance between growth investment and dividends distribution, in line with future prospects, underlying growth in free cash flow, and long-term value creation through investments in available opportunities.

Post-facto intimation of 22 (Twenty Second) meeting of the Committee of Creditors (CoC) - Reliance Capital Limited Reliance Capital Limited has informed the Exchange about update on committee of creditors meetingThis has reference to our intimation dated December 7, 2021, regarding the initiation of corporate insolvency resolution process ("CIRP") in the case of Reliance Capital Limited ("the Company") under Section 227 read with clause (zk) of sub-section (2) of Section 239 of the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code, 2016 (Code).We wish to inform you that the 22 (Twenty Second) meeting of the Committee of Creditors of the Company was duly convened and conducted on Thursday, October 20, 2022, at 2:30 p.m. in Mumbai.At the aforesaid meeting, the Administrator of the Company appraised the Committee of Creditors, inter alia, about the update on the status of claims, status of CIRP process, going concern operations of the Company and the way forward in terms of the activities / milestones as stipulated under the Code.

This has reference to our intimation dated December 7, 2021 regarding the initiation of corporate insolvency resolution process ("CIRP") in the case of Reliance Capital Limited ("the Company") under Section 227 read with clause (zk) of sub-section (2) of Section 239 of the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code, 2016 (Code) and Rules 5 and 6 of the Insolvency and Bankruptcy (Insolvency and Liquidation Proceedings of Financial Service Providers and Application to Adjudication Authority) Rules, 2019 ("FSP Insolvency Rules").The Hon￢ﾀﾙble National Company Law Tribunal, Mumbai, vide its order dated October 18, 2022 in IA 1838/2022 IA 2186/2022 IA 2901/2022 IN C.P./(IB)/1231/(MB)2021, has granted exclusion of 90 days for completion of CIRP till January 30, 2023. In compliance with the provisions of Regulation 30 of the SEBI Listing Regulations, through our intimations dated 13 August 2021 and 23 October 2021 we informed the stock exchanges about Greaves Electric Mobility Private Limited, subsidiary of the Company (GEMPL) entering into definitive agreement to invest in MLR Auto Ltd (MRL) and subsequent completion of initial acquisition (through primary subscription) of 26% of the equity shareholding in MLR on fully diluted basis respectively. As per the said definitive agreements, GEMPL had the right (not an obligation) to enter into second stage acquisition by increasing its shareholding by another 25% (on fully diluted basis) in MLR within 12 months from the date of closing of the initial acquisition. In this regard, we wish to inform that, invocation notice on second stage acquisition has been issued to MLR and the modalities of the same are currently under discussion, which is expected to be closed by the end of FY 2022-23. This is for your information and record.

Rashtriya Chemicals and Fertilizers Limited has informed the Exchange about Intimation pursuant to Regulation 30 of SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015This is to inform you that on 19th October 2022, during installation andcommissioning of a new AC Unit in the control room of the GTG plant of RCF ThalUnit an explosion took place. The job was being carried out by contractor engagedfor supply, installation and commissioning of the new AC unit.During this unfortunate incident, three persons including two contract employeesand one employee of RCF were injured and later succumbed to their injuries. Threecontract employees have been injured and are under treatment in the hospital forthe same.The cause of the incident is under investigation.The plant operations at Thal Unit have not been affected due to this incident and thesame continues to run normally.

Whether order(s) / contract(s) have been awarded by  domestic/ international entity;2. Significant terms and conditions of order(s)/contract(s) awarded in brief;3. Nature of order(s) / contract(s);4. Whether domestic or international;5. Time period by which the order(s)/contract(s) is to be executed;6. Whether the promoter/ promoter group / group companies have any interest in the entity that awarded the order(s)/contract(s)? If yes, nature of interest and details thereof;7. This is to inform that the Board of Directors of the Bank at its meeting held today i.e., on October 15, 2022 has approved the appointment of Mr. Farokh Nariman Subedar (DIN: 00028428) as an Additional Independent Director of the Bank for a period of three years with immediate effect i.e. October 15, 2022. This is subject to approval of shareholders at the next general meeting or within a time period of three months from the date of his appointment, whichever is earlier.  Further, we affirm that Mr. Farokh Nariman Subedar (DIN: 00028428) is not debarred from holding the office of director by virtue of any order of Securities and Exchange Board of India or any other such authority and he is not related to any other Director of the Bank.The Board of Directors at the said meeting also resolved to propose the name of Mr. Farokh Nariman Subedar (DIN: 00028428) for the position of the Independent Non-Executive Part Time Chairman of the Bank and make necessary application to the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) for its approval.Brief profile of Mr. Farokh Nariman Subedar is enclosed as Annexure I.

In reference to the disclosure vide letter dated 01.10.2019, 26.10.2021, 04.12.2021 & 03.08.2022 referred above, wherein MSTC Limited had already disclosed about the dispute pending between MSTC Limited and Standard Chartered Bank ("SCB") with respect to the receivable purchase agreement dated August 29, 2008 ("RPA") entered into by our Company with SCB wherein, SCB purchased the receivables from our Company in relation to the export of gold jewellery and the subsequent proceedings of Recovery Officer to auction the attached properties of MSTC Limited as well as the steps taken by MSTC Limited to protect its interest including appeal filed against the underlying interim order before the Debt Recovery Appellate Tribunal (DRAT), Mumbai, including the deposit of Rs.90 crore before the DRAT.  We would like to state that pending the appeal of MSTC Limited before the DRAT, the Recovery Officer has finalized the auction programme to sell the attached properties of MSTC Limited and auction date is fixed as 14.11.2022. It is to state that the appeal filed by MSTC Limited is pending before the DRAT, Mumbai, which is scheduled next on 17.10.2022 and MSTC Limited is taking all the possible legal steps to protect the interest of the Company.This is for your information and records.

This intimation is in continuation to our earlier intimation dated October 7, 2022 regarding receipt of certified copy of the Order passed by the Hon ble National Company Law Tribunal ( NCLT ) on October 3, 2022 approving the scheme of amalgamation (by way of merger by absorption) of Pranavaditya Spinning Mills Limited ( PSML ), Subsidiary Company with the Company under Sections 230-232 of the Companies Act, 2013 ( the Scheme ). The Scheme shall come into effect, upon filing of certified true copy of the order with the Registrar of Companies.Pursuant to the powers conferred by the Board, Stakeholders Relationship Committee (SRC) of the Company, at its meeting held today, has fixed Thursday, October 27, 2022 as the Record Date, for determining the names of the shareholders of Pranavaditya Spinning Mills Limited to whom equity shares of the Company will be allotted as per the swap-ratio pursuant to the Scheme and for the issuance and allotment of equity shares of the Company to the shareholders of PSML.

Pursuant to Regulation 30 read with Schedule III of the Listing Regulations, we are enclosing herewith the Postal Ballot Notice dated October 11 , 2022 (the 'Notice'), together with Explanatory Statement which is being sent to the Members on their registered email address, seeking approval for the following Special Business as set out in the said Notice:￢ﾀﾢ Re-appointment of Mr Anil Harish (DIN: 00001685) as an Independent Director of the Company to hold office for a second consecutive term of five years commencing from November 22, 2022 to November 21, 2027In compliance with the Ministry of Corporate Affairs circulars, physical copies of the Notice, postal ballot forms and pre-paid business envelopes are not being sent to Members for this Postal Ballot. Notice is being sent in electronic form only.The remote e-voting period will commence on Saturday, October 15, 2022 (09:00 hours IST) and will end on Sunday, November 13, 2022 (17:00 hours IST). During this period, Members of the Company holding shares either in physical form or in dematerialised form, as on the cut-off date i.e. Tuesday, October 11, 2022, may cast their votes communicating assent or dissent by way of remote e-voting system only.The results of Postal Ballot through remote e-voting shall be declared on or before Tuesday, November 15, 2022 at any time before 5:00 p.m.The said information is also being made available on the website of the Company at www.bluestarindia.com.Kindly take the same on records.

This is in continuation to our earlier letter dated August 30, 2022 informing that the Hon￢ﾀﾙble National Company Law Tribunal, Chandigarh Bench (￢ﾀﾘNCLT￢ﾀﾙ), has vide its Order dated August 29, 2022, inter-alia directed that meeting of the Equity Shareholders, Secured Creditors and Unsecured Creditors of the Company be convened on November 15, 2022 through Video Conferencing to consider/ approve the Scheme.Accordingly, a Meeting of the Unsecured Creditors of the Company is scheduled to be held on Tuesday, November 15, 2022 at 02:00 p.m. through video conferencing ("VC") /  other audio visual means (￢ﾀﾜOAVM￢ﾀﾝ) for the purpose of their considering, and if thought fit, approving the Scheme.The Notice of the said meeting along with annexures is attached herewith and is also available on the website of the Company at https://www.niit.com/india/training/investors/Pages/Scheme-of-Arrangement-2022.aspx.

We refer to our communications (i) dated August 31, 2021, intimating that the Board of Directors of the Company at their meeting held on August 31 2021, had approved the sale of 100% equity shares held by the Company in Crossword Bookstores Private Limited (￢ﾀﾜCrossword￢ﾀﾝ), to M/s. Dinesh Gupta, Aakash Gupta & Family (Owners of Agarwal Business House) (ABH), Pune; (ii) subsequent communication dated October 11, 2021, intimating that the Company had completed the sale of 51% stake of the Company in Crossword and that Crossword had ceased to be a subsidiary of the Company.(iii) Communication dated April 08, 2022, intimating further sale of 19.50% of stake of the Company, reduced stake to 29.50%.In continuation to the above, the Company is pleased to inform that as per the agreed terms for sale of 100% equity shares of Crossword, the Company has completed the further sale of 19.50% of stake of the Company in Crossword today i.e. October 12, 2022. Accordingly, the Company￢ﾀﾙs equity stake in Crossword stands reduced to 10.00% and Crossword is ceased to be Associate Company.You are requested to take the same on your records.

Brief details of any governmental or regulatory approvals required for the acquisition; 2. Nature of consideration - whether cash consideration or share swap and details of the same; The response of the company is awaited.

Accordingly, the Company￢ﾀﾙs equity stake in Crossword stands reduced to 10.00% and Crossword is ceased to be Associate Company.You are requested to take the same on your records.

This has reference to our intimation dated December 7, 2021 regarding the initiation of corporate insolvency resolution process ("CIRP") in the case of Reliance Capital Limited ("the Company") under Section 227 read with clause (zk) of sub-section (2) of Section 239 of the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code, 2016 (Code).We wish to inform you that the 21st (Twenty-First) meeting of the Committee of Creditors of the Company was duly convened and conducted on Tuesday, October 11, 2022 at 12:00 noon in Mumbai.At the aforesaid meeting, the Administrator of the Company appraised the Committee of Creditors, inter alia, about the update on the status of claims, status of CIRP process, going concern operations of the Company and the way forward in terms of the activities / milestones as stipulated under the Code.

column6: Dear Sir/Madam,We hereby submitting my reply pointwise for the query raised.1. Due to some Practical reasons which were beyond our control we could not upload the same within 30 minutes of the conclusion of the Board meeting.As per Regulation 30 sub- regulation 6 of LODR, we hereby request you to condone such delay. We will be highly obliged.2. We had uploaded the said as per all the requirements and had converted the same in the readable machine form before uploading. It might have happened due to some technical glitch that it did not detected some few part of the pages and convert the same in such machine readable form.3. As we are sick company the requirement to prepare such is not applicable.4. We have already mentioned such in the Document attached. Kindly find the attached document for your reference.Thank you.

NOTICE CONVENING THE MEETING OF UNSECURED CREDITORS OF JHS SVENDGAARD LABORATORIES LIMITED (DEMERGED/TRANSFEREE COMPANY) AS PER THE DIRECTIONS OF HON￢ﾀﾙBLE NCLT, CHANDIGARH BENCHNOTICE is hereby given that by the Orders dated 30th August, 2022 and 29th September, 2022, Hon￢ﾀﾙble NCLT has directed that a meeting of the Unsecured Creditors of the Company be convened and held through Video Conferencing (￢ﾀﾜVC￢ﾀﾝ) with facility of remote e-voting , for the purpose of considering, and if thought fit, approving, with or without modification(s), the arrangement embodied in the Composite Scheme of Arrangement for Demerger and Amalgamation between JHS Svendgaard Retail Ventures Private Limited (￢ﾀﾘResulting Company￢ﾀﾙ) and JHS Svendgaard Brands Limited (￢ﾀﾘTransferor Company￢ﾀﾙ) and JHS Svendgaard Laboratories Limited (￢ﾀﾘDemerged Company/Transferee Company￢ﾀﾙ) and their respective Shareholders and Creditors (￢ﾀﾜScheme￢ﾀﾝ/￢ﾀﾜScheme of Arrangement￢ﾀﾝ) under the provisions of Section 230-232 of the Companies Act, 2013 and therefore notice is hereby given that a meeting of the Unsecured Creditors of the Company will be held through VC on Sunday, November 13, 2022 at 03:00 PM (IST).

NOTICE CONVENING THE MEETING OF SECURED CREDITORS OF JHS SVENDGAARD LABORATORIES LIMITED (DEMERGED/TRANSFEREE COMPANY) AS PER THE DIRECTIONS OF HON￢ﾀﾙBLE NCLT, CHANDIGARH BENCHNOTICE is hereby given that by the Orders dated 30th August, 2022 and 29th September, 2022, Hon￢ﾀﾙble NCLT has directed that a meeting of the Secured Creditors of the Company be convened and held through Video Conferencing (￢ﾀﾜVC￢ﾀﾝ) with facility of remote e-voting , for the purpose of considering, and if thought fit, approving, with or without modification(s), the arrangement embodied in the Composite Scheme of Arrangement for Demerger and Amalgamation between JHS Svendgaard Retail Ventures Private Limited (￢ﾀﾘResulting Company￢ﾀﾙ) and JHS Svendgaard Brands Limited (￢ﾀﾘTransferor Company￢ﾀﾙ) and JHS Svendgaard Laboratories Limited (￢ﾀﾘDemerged Company/Transferee Company￢ﾀﾙ) and their respective Shareholders and Creditors (￢ﾀﾜScheme￢ﾀﾝ/￢ﾀﾜScheme of Arrangement￢ﾀﾝ) under the provisions of Section 230-232 of the Companies Act, 2013 and therefore notice is hereby given that a meeting of the Secured Creditors of the Company will be held through VC on Sunday, November 13, 2022 at 02:00 PM (IST).

NOTICE CONVENING THE MEETING OF EQUITY SHAREHOLDERS OF JHS SVENDGAARD LABORATORIES LIMITED (DEMERGED/TRANSFEREE COMPANY) AS PER THE DIRECTIONS OF HON￢ﾀﾙBLE NCLT, CHANDIGARH BENCHNOTICE is hereby given that by the Orders dated 30th August, 2022 and 29th September, 2022 (￢ﾀﾜOrder￢ﾀﾝ/￢ﾀﾜNCLT Order￢ﾀﾝ), Hon￢ﾀﾙble NCLT has directed that a meeting of the Equity Shareholders of the Company be convened and held through Video Conferencing (￢ﾀﾜVC￢ﾀﾝ) with facility of remote e-voting , for the purpose of considering, and if thought fit, approving, with or without modification(s), the arrangement embodied in the Composite Scheme of Arrangement for Demerger and Amalgamation between JHS Svendgaard Retail Ventures Private Limited (￢ﾀﾘResulting Company￢ﾀﾙ) and JHS Svendgaard Brands Limited (￢ﾀﾘTransferor Company￢ﾀﾙ) and JHS Svendgaard Laboratories Limited (￢ﾀﾘDemerged Company/Transferee Company￢ﾀﾙ) and their respective Shareholders and Creditors (￢ﾀﾜScheme￢ﾀﾝ/￢ﾀﾜScheme of Arrangement￢ﾀﾝ) under theprovisions of Section 230-232 of the Companies Act, 2013. Accordingly, notice is hereby given that a meeting of the Equity Shareholders of the Company will be held through VC on Sunday, November 13, 2022 at 10:30 AM (IST).

This is to inform that based on the recommendations made by the Nomination and Remuneration Committee, the Board of Directors of the Bank at its meeting held today i.e. 10th October, 2022, inter alia, considered and approved the re-appointment of Mr. Raj Vikash Verma as the Part-time Chairman of the Bank, with effect from 08th April, 2023 till 29th January, 2024 (i.e. till completion of his tenure as Independent Director on the Board of the Bank), subject to the approval of the Reserve Bank of India and members of the Bank, pursuant to applicable regulatory requirements.Mr. Raj Vikash Verma joined the Board of Directors of the Bank as Independent Director (Non-Executive) on 30th January, 2018 and took charge as Part-time Chairman of Bank on 8th April, 2020 post receipt of approval from RBI.It is further confirmed that Mr. Raj Vikash Verma is not debarred from holding the office of Director by virtue of any SEBI order or any other such authority.

Gujarat Alkalies and Chemicals Limited has informed the Exchange about Updates under Regulation 30(3) of SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015 - Dedication of various new plants to Nation by Hon￢ﾀﾙble Prime Minister of India. Gujarat Alkalies and Chemicals Limited (GACL) has recently completed various new Projects for producing new chemicals and expanding the capacities of current product lines. A joint venture company with National Aluminium Company Limited (NALCO) has also completed installation of 800 TPD Caustic Soda Plant, integrated with 130 MW Captive Co-generation Plant.The Company has from time to time informed the Stock Exchanges on updates on commissioning of :- ￢ﾀﾢ	105,000 TPA Chloromethanes Project at Dahej, ￢ﾀﾢ	10,000 TPA Hydrazine Hydrate Project at Dahej, ￢ﾀﾢ	173,250 TPA Caustic Soda Expansion at Dahej and ￢ﾀﾢ	267,000 TPA New Caustic Soda Plant with 130 MW Thermal Power Plant at Dahej, put-up as a joint venture between GACL and NALCO.We would now like to inform that today i.e. 10th October, 2022, the Hon'ble Prime Minister has dedicated all the above Plants to the Nation during the function organized by Gujarat Industrial Development Corporation (GIDC) at Amod, Bharuch.With the implementation of the above projects, the Company is proud to have taken major step towards ￢ﾀﾜAtmanirbhar Bharat￢ﾀﾝ ￢ﾀﾓ a vision of the Hon￢ﾀﾙble Prime Minister of India for making India a self-reliant nation in Chemical sector.

Name of the entity awarding the order(s)/contract(s);2. Significant terms and conditions of order(s)/contract(s) awarded in brief;3. Whether order(s) / contract(s) have been awarded by  domestic/ international entity;4. Nature of order(s) / contract(s);5. Whether domestic or international;6. Time period by which the order(s)/contract(s) is to be executed;7. Broad consideration or size of the order(s)/contract(s);8. Whether the promoter/ promoter group / group companies have any interest in the entity that awarded the order(s)/contract(s)? If yes, nature of interest and details thereof;9. Whether the order(s)/contract(s) would fall within related party transactions? If yes, whether the same is done at ?arms length?.The response of the company is attached.

With reference to e-postal ballot process undertaken by Lyka Labs Limited for seeking approval of the Members for -1. The Exchange has sought clarification from W S Industries (I) Limited with respect to announcement dated on 30-Sep-2022 informing about Bagging orders/contract.On the basis of aforesaid announcement, the Company is required to provide/clarify the following: 1. Name of the entity awarding the order(s)/contract(s); 2. Significant terms and conditions of order(s)/contract(s) awarded in brief; 3. Whether order(s) / contract(s) have been awarded by  domestic/ international entity; 4. Nature of order(s) / contract(s); 5. Whether domestic or international; 6. Time period by which the order(s)/contract(s) is to be executed; 7. Broad consideration or size of the order(s)/contract(s); 8. Whether the promoter/ promoter group / group companies have any interest in the entity that awarded the order(s)/contract(s)? If yes, nature of interest and details thereof; 9. Whether the order(s)/contract(s) would fall within related party transactions? If yes, whether the same is done at ?arms length?. The response of the company is awaited.

In this context we wish to inform you that the Allotment Committee of the Company has, today, approved allotment of 91,461 Ordinary Shares of the face value of ￢ﾂﾹ2 each under the Scheme to the eligible employees pursuant to exercise of stock options at an exercise price of ￢ﾂﾹ345 per share.Consequent to the aforesaid allotment, the paid-up Ordinary share capital of the Company stands increased from ￢ﾂﾹ6,64,28,27,993 divided into 3,32,11,75,244 Ordinary Shares of ￢ﾂﾹ2 each to ￢ﾂﾹ6,64,30,10,915 divided into 3,32,12,66,705 Ordinary Shares of ￢ﾂﾹ2 each (considering the amount of subscribed share capital plus shares forfeited less calls in arrears).The aforesaid Ordinary Shares shall rank pari passu in all aspects with the existing Ordinary Shares of the Company.We request the exchanges to take the aforesaid disclosure in their records.

Ashoka Buildcon Limited (￢ﾀﾜthe Company￢ﾀﾝ) is pleased to inform the Stock Exchange that Ashoka Highways (Durg) Limited (￢ﾀﾜAHDL￢ﾀﾝ), a subsidiary of Ashoka Concessions Limited, a subsidiary of the Company, has received an extension of total 240 days in Concession Period from the end date of Concession period i.e. July 22, 2028 to March 19, 2029, vide NHAI letter dated 06/10/2022 to compensate AHDL for the loss of toll collection, as full and final settlement in respect of all the claims, under the Concession Agreement.These disputes did arise between AHDL and National highways Authority of India (￢ﾀﾜNHAI￢ﾀﾝ) during the execution and operation of the Concession. AHDL and NHAI had jointly approached the Conciliation committee of Independent experts for the settlement of claims. As a settlement under the conciliation, AHDL & NHAI have agreed to amicably settle the claims and accordingly have executed the settlement Agreement, pursuant to which NHAI granted extension of Concession Period. This disclosure is filed under Regulation 30 of SEBI LODR Regulations, 2015.

This has reference to the Annual Report of the Company for financial year 2021-22 which included the Notice convening the AGM (￢ﾀﾜNotice￢ﾀﾝ) that we had submitted to the stock exchanges on 23 September, 2022. We hereby inform you that the resolution at item no. 4 of the Notice for Appointment of Mr.Saurav Adhikari as an Independent Director was inadvertently mentioned as an Ordinary Resolution. This resolution is proposed to be passed as a Special Resolution as required by Securities and Exchange Board of India (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) (ThirdAmendment) Regulations, 2021 effective from 1 January 2022. Accordingly, at Item No. 4 of the Notice, the words ￢ﾀﾜTo consider and if thought fit, to pass the following resolution as an Ordinary Resolution￢ﾀﾝ be replaced with the words ￢ﾀﾜTo consider and if thought fit, to pass the following resolution as a Special Resolution￢ﾀﾝ. Similarly, the words ￢ﾀﾜOrdinary Resolution￢ﾀﾝ appearing in the last para of the Explanatory Statement to item no. 4 of the Notice be replaced with the words￢ﾀﾜSpecial Resolution￢ﾀﾝ.Please find attached the revised Notice of the AGM.We regret for the inconvenience caused to you in this regard.

October 01, 2022 in place of Mr. Pankaj Sachdeva, we wish to inform you that Mr. Shailesh Kumar, has taken over charge as CEO ￢ﾀﾓ India Cluster (Key Managerial Personnel) of the Company w.e.f October 01, 2022 in place of Mr. Pankaj Sachdeva.The Board of Directors of the Company vide circular resolution dated October 03, 2022 has relieved Mr. Pankaj Sachdeva from the position of CEO ￢ﾀﾓ India Cluster (Key Managerial Personnel) from the close of business hours of September 30, 2022.The Board of Directors of the Company placed on record their appreciation for the valuable services rendered by Mr. Pankaj Sachdeva to the Company during his tenure as CEO - India Cluster (Key Managerial Personnel). Prajay Engineers Syndicate Limited  has informed the Exchange about appointment of Mr. Dantapally Vijaysen Reddy  as Managing Director of the company w.e.f. 05-Sep-2022Sub: Intimation of Appointment/Re-Appointment of the Directors of the Company Ref: Regulation 30 of SEBI (Listing Obligation and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015Dear Sir/Madam, In continuation to our intimation dated 5 September 2022, and pursuant to Regulation 30 of SEBI (Listing Obligation and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015, we hereby inform that, based on the recommendation of the Nomination & Remuneration Committee and Board of Directors of the Company, the members in the 28th Annual General Meeting of the Company held on 30 September 2022 approved the appointment of Mr. Dantapally Vijaysen Reddy as Chairman and Managing Director of the Company for a term of 3 (Three years) w.e.f. 05-09-2022 without any remuneration.  Further, we would like to inform that the abovementioned Directors are not debarred from holding the office of Director by virtue of any SEBI order or any other authority pursuant to circular number NSE/CML/2018/24 dated 20 June 2018. The details, as required under SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015, read with SEBI Circular No. CIR/CFD/CMD/4/2015 dated 9 September 2015 along with the brief profile, are given in Annexure A to this letter.This is for your information and records.

Motilal Oswal Financial Services Limited has informed the Exchange that Mr. Prateek Agrawal has been appointed as Executive Director, Motilal Oswal Asset Management Business. Motilal Oswal Asset Management Company Limited (￢ﾀﾜMOAMC￢ﾀﾝ) is a material subsidiary of Motilal Oswal Financial Services Limited (￢ﾀﾜthe Company/MOFSL￢ﾀﾝ).Prior to joining MOAMC, he was the Business Head and Chief Investment Officer at ASK Investment Managers and managed assets of over Rs. 80,000 crore, including some of the largest flagship funds. In his earlier roles he worked as Head of Equity of BNP Paribas Mutual Fund and BOI AXA Mutual Fund and as Head of Research of SBI Capital Markets.Mr. Agrawal has rich experience of over 28 years in fund management and equity research and has excellent track record of wealth creation for investors. He will be overseeing the Business & Investment Strategy of MOAMC. His appointment will further enhance the vision of creating wealth for investors and accelerate the growth of MOAMC. Mr. Agrawal has strong academic credentials of Bachelor of Engineering from NIT Rourkela and PGDM in Finance & Marketing from XIM-Bhubaneshwar.

Raj Television Network Limited has informed the Exchange about Refer: Notice Calling 28th AGM of the company. And agenda item no.3:-reappointment of statutory auditors of the company. Agenda Item 3 of Notice Calling 28th AGM of the company: Reappointment of statutory Auditors of the company: - The company duly complied with Notice calling AGM and adoption of the said agenda item no 3 during the 28th AGM held on Friday, 30th September 2022. The Company had made all efforts and taken necessary steps to the extent possible in the circumstances to intimate Members on convening of the AGM and to enable them to participate and vote on the matters being considered at this AGM. After the result is communicated by Scrutiniser, the error is found out that the agenda item which was considered during the 28th AGM and it was observed that during the Activation of EVSN for Evoting, the resolution was not captured for voting by members due to an inadvertent error in uploading the files in the EVSN and the resolution was recorded as not voted during the e-voting process.  The Chairman of the AGM decided to extend the E-Voting for the said agenda and notice for the same shall be send to all the members on 3rd October 2022. The Evoting Period Commences from 4th October 2022 Tuesday at 9 am and ends with 6th October 2022 Thursday at 5 pm. All other instructions and information as per original Notice calling 28th AGM shall follow for conducting E-voting for Agenda item no 3. Members are requested for record their voting for the resolution. The scrutinizer appointed by the company shall be the same scrutiniser for conducting E-Voting and declaration of the results.

column6: In the recent past, there have been news articles alleging the issuance of arrest warrants by a Magistrate Court in Begusarai, Bihar against the Promoter Directors of the Company, Mrs. Shobha Kapoor and Ms. Ekta Kapoor. These news articles, which appear to have been made on the basis of alleged statements of the advocate for the individual who has filed the complaint, are false and inaccurate, as no arrest warrants have been received by Mrs. Shobha Kapoor or Ms. Ekta Kapoor.You are requested to take the aforementioned information on your record.

The three STRPP will be of different face value, different maturity and shall be redeemable (i) at par; and (ii) in a staggered manner was filled with stock exchanges and SEBI on 30.09.2022.
